      • newGame

        public void newGame(MapItems[][] map,
           java.util.List<java.awt.Point> blocks,
           Bomber[] players,
           int playerIndex)
        Gets called every time a new game starts.
        Specified by:
        newGame in interface Player
        Parameters:
        map - The map.
        blocks - All the blocks on the map.
        players - Current position, bomb range, and bomb count for both Bombers.
        playerIndex - Your player index.

      • getMove

        public PlayerAction getMove(MapItems[][] map,
                   java.util.HashMap<java.awt.Point,Bomb> bombLocations,
                   java.util.HashMap<java.awt.Point,PowerUps> powerUpLocations,
                   Bomber[] players,
                   java.util.List<java.awt.Point> explosionLocations,
                   int playerIndex,
                   int moveNumber)
        Gets called every time a move is requested from the game server. Provided is a very random and not smart AI which random moves without checking for explosions, and places bombs whenever bombs can be used to destroy blocks.
        Specified by:
        getMove in interface Player
        Parameters:
        map - The current map
        bombLocations - Bombs currently on the map and it's range, owner and time left Exploding bombs are excluded.
        powerUpLocations - Power-ups current on the map and it's type
        players - Current position, bomb range, and bomb count for both Bombers
        explosionLocations - Explosions currently on the map.
        playerIndex - Your player index.
        moveNumber - The current move number.
        Returns:
        the PlayerAction you want your Bomber to perform.

      • isThereAPath

        public boolean isThereAPath(java.awt.Point start,
                   java.awt.Point end,
                   MapItems[][] map)
        Uses Breadth First Search to find if a walkable path from point A to point B exists. This method does not consider the if tiles are dangerous or not. As long as all the tiles in are walkable.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting point
        end - The end point
        map - The map use to check if a path exists between point A and point B
        Returns:
        True if there is a walkable path between point A and point B, False otherwise.

      • manhattanDistance

        public int manhattanDistance(java.awt.Point start,
                    java.awt.Point end)
        Returns the Manhattan Distance between the two points.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting point
        end - the end point
        Returns:
        the Manhattan Distance between the two points.
